item.title: Qué significa nominate
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 262 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: nominate
item.description: This word has appeared in 262 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Late Night Shades Trump’s Impromptu ‘Liar-side Chat’
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel called the president’s last-minute speech “a surprise prime-time episode of ‘The Worst Wing’ tonight on every channel.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

item.title: Australia Mourns the Youngest Victim of the Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: Sydney’s devastated Jewish community gathered for the funeral of “Matilda Bee,” an ebullient, smiling 10-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Damien Cave

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A mourner carrying a balloon bearing Matilda’s name and an illustration of a bee, an insect she was known to love, before her funeral in Sydney, Australia, on Thursday.

item.title: Trump Boasts About Economy in Prime Time Speech
item.description: The president gave a televised speech that featured repeated criticism of Democrats and his predecessor, Joseph R. Biden Jr., along with boasts about gains that many Americans have said they are not experiencing.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

item.title: Trump Officials Announce More Than $11 Billion in Arms Sales for Taiwan
item.description: The move may reassure China hawks who are uncertain about the president’s commitment to the self-governing democracy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley

media:content.media:description: The arms package would include more than $4 billion each for high mobility artillery rocket systems, known as HIMARS.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Address to the Nation
item.description: President Trump disparaged Democrats and insisted the economy is booming despite concerns about the cost of living.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger

media:content.media:description: President Trump in an address from the White House on Wednesday argued that U.S. economy under his leadership is in better shape than many voters think.

item.title: Era el rey de la comedia nocturna en Rusia. Ahora trabaja en cumpleaños y bodas
item.description: Ivan Urgant era una megaestrella rusa imparable hasta que expresó su oposición a la invasión de Putin en Ucrania.
item.dc:creator: Paul Sonne

media:content.media:description: El animador ruso Ivan Urgant, a la derecha, presentando Evening Urgant, que salió del aire en 2022, después de que hiciera una publicación antibelicista en las redes sociales.

item.title: Birthrates Are Falling, but Don’t Blame Dogs in Strollers
item.description: New research suggests that having a pet can actually make people more likely to become parents.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Taub

media:content.media:description: Strolling in Seoul. A South Korean official said young couples were choosing pets over children, but it might not be that simple.

item.title: At Tokyo Zoo, Visitors Worry Pandas Could Be China’s Next Target
item.description: Pandas have stood for friendship between China and Japan since 1972. But the last two are about to go, and a dispute over Taiwan could get in the way of sending more.
item.dc:creator: Javier C. Hernández and Hisako Ueno

media:content.media:description: Visitors watching Lei Lei, one of the Ueno Zoo’s two giant pandas, in Tokyo on Tuesday.

item.title: E.U. Leaders Debate Plan for Ukraine Financed by Frozen Russian Assets
item.description: The European Council convenes on Thursday, and at stake is a contentious deal to back Ukraine and its war effort in 2026 and 2027.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek

media:content.media:credit: Laetitia Vancon for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ukrainian soldiers during a live-fire training exercise at a military training ground in the Dnipro region, in December.

item.title: China Is Feeling Strong and Senses an American Retreat
item.description: Beijing is using its messaging tools to show off its prowess at building infrastructure and project power, taking advantage of what it says is “deep anxiety” in U.S. policies.
item.dc:creator: Li Yuan

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 18, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Thursday, Dec. 18, 2025.

item.title: Quote of the Day: A Coach Pokes and Prods at Every Weakness to Hone Schwarber’s Bat
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, December 18, 2025.

item.title: U.S. Military Announces 4 Killed in 26th Boat Strike
item.description: The attack on Wednesday brings the total number killed to at least 99 since the Trump administration began bombing boats suspected of ferrying drugs in the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

media:content.media:description: U.S. attacks on boats off South America have drawn the ire of legal experts and many members of Congress, who contend that the strikes amount to extrajudicial killings and, potentially, war crimes.

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Prime-Time Address on the Economy
item.description: The president cited misleading statistics to insist, wrongly, that prices were coming down.
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu
item.category: White House Council of Economic Advisers

media:content.media:description: President Trump used a prime-time address to praise what he cast as the economic gains under his administration.

item.title: Australia to Crack Down on Hate Speech After Bondi Attack
item.description: New legislation will be drafted to target those who promote violence and to increase penalties for hate speech, the prime minister said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: New South Wales police officers escorting the hearse carrying Rabbi Eli Schlanger after his funeral in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday.

item.title: Full Transcript of President Trump’s Speech on the Economy
item.description: The president sharply attacked his predecessor while insisting that his own record contained nothing but victories.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:description: “Over the past 11 months, we have brought more positive change to Washington than any administration in American history,” President Trump said in his address to the nation on Wednesday night from the Diplomatic Reception Room of the White House.

item.title: In Combative Speech, Trump Tries to Deflect Blame for Economic Concerns
item.description: Mixing misleading claims with repeated attacks, President Trump promised relief for Americans but said he needed time to deliver it.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater

item.title: Peter Arnett, Pulitzer-Winning War Correspondent, Dies at 91
item.description: He won the prestigious award for his daring coverage of the Vietnam War for The Associated Press, and went on to cover conflicts for CNN for nearly two decades.
item.dc:creator: Robert D. McFadden

media:content.media:description: Peter Arnett covered conflicts for decades, first for The Associated Press and then for CNN.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 18, 2025
item.description: Joseph Gangi asks us to mind our Q’s.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:description: It’s time to conquer Joseph Gangi’s puzzle.

item.title: Dinaw Mengestu Will Be New President of PEN America
item.description: The novelist Dinaw Mengestu will lead the literary group at a time of escalating threats to free expression at home and abroad.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Schuessler

media:content.media:credit: Lauren Lancaster for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Dinaw Mengestu, who was born in Ethiopia and moved to the United States when he was 2, has published four novels.

item.title: Wesley Morris Remembers Rob Reiner’s Movies
item.description: This week, Wesley reflects on the impact Rob Reiner had on his life, specifically the 1990 film “Misery,” and how Reiner brought humanity to his characters in unexpected ways.
item.dc:creator: Pat Gunther, Austin Mitchell and Felice Leon

item.title: Shock and Sadness Hang Over the Reiners’ Neighborhood
item.description: Neighbors said a pall had fallen over the wealthy Los Angeles area where Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, were found stabbed to death.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Parsons

media:content.media:description: Holiday decorations and no trespassing signs on a gate outside the Reiners’ home on Tuesday.

item.title: U.S. Government Admits Liability in Deadly D.C.-Area Air Collision
item.description: A federal court filing says the Army crew piloting a Black Hawk helicopter could have avoided the nighttime accident in January if it had been able to see and avoid a commercial jet.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Kate Kelly
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Al Drago for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A crane lifting a piece of the wreckage of an American Airlines jet from the Potomac River in February.

item.title: Fani Willis Defends Failed Election Interference Case in Heated Hearing
item.description: The Atlanta-area district attorney called President Trump and his allies “criminals” while being questioned by a Georgia Senate committee on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling
item.category: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)

media:content.media:description: District Attorney Fani T. Willis assailed Republican adversaries and stumped for political allies at the hearing on Wednesday.

item.title: Photographer Finds More Than 2,000 Dinosaur Footprints in the Italian Alps
item.description: While hiking in the Italian Alps in September, a nature photographer came upon a surface speckled with more than 2,000 dinosaur footprints. The site is not that far from Bormio, where Alpine skiing will take place at the Winter Olympics in February.
item.dc:creator: Elisabetta Povoledo and Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:credit: Elio Della Ferrara/Arch. PaleoStelvio (PNS, MSNM, SABAP CO-LC)
media:content.media:description: Dinosaurs once roamed the earth, including, it seems, in this spot in Italy.

item.title: Trump Pressed Georgia Speaker to Overturn State’s Election Vote in 2020 Call
item.description: During much of the 12.5-minute call, President Trump reiterated his claims that he had won Georgia, a state he lost by more than 11,000 votes that year.
item.dc:creator: Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
item.category: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)

media:content.media:credit: Audra Melton for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: David Ralston, the former Georgia House speaker, in 2018.

item.title: Watch Live: President Trump Delivers Address to the Nation
item.description: President Trump delivers an address to the nation on Wednesday evening.

item.title: For Hegseth, There Is One Boat Strike He Doesn’t Want the Public to See
item.description: The Pentagon has released plenty of video clips that show American missiles blowing boats suspected of carrying drugs out of the water. But the “double tap” strike on Sept. 2 is being kept under wraps.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth briefed senators on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump Unveils Presidential ‘Walk of Fame’ With Jabs at Biden and Obama
item.description: The White House unveiled plaques near the Oval Office that describe U.S. presidents with varying levels of accuracy, depending on President Trump’s opinion of them.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: The presidential walk of fame, the latest addition to the White House, seen at the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump’s National Address: What Time and What to Expect
item.description: President Trump will address the nation on Wednesday night at 9 p.m. Eastern time. The New York Times will provide live coverage and analysis.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green, Tony Romm, David E. Sanger and Luke Broadwater

item.title: Trump Delivers Attacks and Deflects Blame for Americans’ Economic Worries
item.description: The president gave a televised speech that featured repeated criticism of Democrats and his predecessor, Joseph R. Biden Jr., along with boasts about gains that many Americans have said they are not experiencing.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Asks a Judge to Throw Out Her Sex-Abuse Conviction
item.description: Ms. Maxwell, who conspired with Jeffrey Epstein in a sex-trafficking scheme, argued that she had been denied a fair trial.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Weiser

media:content.media:description: Ghislaine Maxwell is serving a 20-year prison sentence and has recently been moved to a minimum-security facility.

item.title: Senate Passes Air Safety Measure, Reversing Provision in Defense Bill
item.description: The legislation restores restrictions on military aircraft flying near busy airports, implemented after a fatal collision near D.C. in January, that had been removed in the defense bill.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

media:content.media:credit: Andrew Leyden for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: After the Jan. 29 midair collision between a commercial jet and an Army helicopter near Ronald Reagan National Airport outside Washington, the federal government tightened restrictions on when military aircraft could fly without enhanced tracking technology.

item.title: The Year in Pictures 2025: Reflecting on Turbulent Times
item.description: Reflections of Turbulent Times

item.title: ICE Must Allow Lawmakers to Inspect Detention Centers, Judge Rules
item.description: Judge Jia M. Cobb wrote that two policies announced in June appeared to unlawfully bar members of Congress from making unannounced visits at immigration detention facilities.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague and Michael Gold

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Federal agents outside Delaney Hall Detention Facility in Newark in June. Immigration and Customs Enforcement has curbed access to its detention centers and required seven days’ notice for lawmakers seeking entry.

item.title: Venezuelans Express Anger at Trump’s Oil Tanker Blockade
item.description: Venezuelans spoke out after President Trump ordered a “complete blockade” of sanctioned oil tankers going to and from Venezuela. Hours after he announced the blockade, the Venezuelan Navy began escorting tankers sailing around the country’s east coast.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: An oil tanker anchored near the Cardón Refinery in Punto Fijo, Venezuela, in 2021.

item.title: Nick Reiner Seen at Los Angeles Gas Station Before Arrest
item.description: Security camera footage from a gas station convenience store in Los Angeles shows Nick Reiner buying a sports drink. About an hour later, Mr. Reiner is arrested across the street. Mr. Reiner was charged with first-degree murder in the stabbing deaths of his parents, Rob and Michele Singer Reiner.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

item.title: Search for Suspect in Brown University Shooting Stretches to 4th Day
item.description: Officials said that they were working with physical evidence, including DNA, and that they were seeking a second man who appeared to have crossed paths with the possible suspect.
item.dc:creator: Jacey Fortin and Chelsia Rose Marcius

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A memorial on the Brown University campus in Providence, R.I., on Wednesday.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Donald Trump Jr. and More Conservative Figures Announce Their Engagements
item.description: Several prominent conservative figures have announced that they are engaged this week, news often celebrated by President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. confirmed his engagement this week to Bettina Anderson, a Florida influencer and Palm Beach socialite.

item.title: Twelve Men Saturated East Harlem Housing Project With Drugs, U.S. Says
item.description: For more than three and a half years, officials said, the men used the Johnson Houses as “an open drug market” to sell crack cocaine and fentanyl.
item.dc:creator: Maria Cramer

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: “No New Yorker should have to live with drug dealers at their doorstep,” said Jay Clayton, the U.S. attorney.

item.title: Israel Approves $37 Billion Deal to Deliver Gas to Egypt
item.description: Israel’s granting of an export permit is the final step to allow the deal, first announced by energy companies in August, to proceed.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni and Johnatan Reiss

media:content.media:credit: Ofir Berman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Leviathan gas field in the Mediterranean Sea off Israel’s northern coast. Gas is vital to Israel’s economy, typically accounting for about 70 percent of electric power generation.

item.title: House Passes Bill to Ban Gender Transition Treatments for Minors
item.description: The measure had little chance of consideration in the Senate, where it would need bipartisan support to move, but it reflected the priorities of the Republican majority.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni and Aishvarya Kavi

media:content.media:description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, Republican of Georgia, sponsored the legislation criminalizing gender affirming care.

item.title: Bongino dejará su cargo en el FBI
item.description: La salida de Dan Bongino parecía inevitable desde agosto, cuando la Casa Blanca contrató al fiscal general de Misuri, Andrew Bailey, para que compartiera el cargo de subdirector con él.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman and Adam Goldman

media:content.media:description: Dan Bongino, subdirector del FBI, en el Capitolio el mes pasado

item.title: Bodies of Rob and Michele Reiner Were Found in Master Bedroom, Police Say
item.description: After finding the slain couple, investigators focused on their younger son, Nick, as a suspect. He was formally charged with murder on Tuesday and appeared in court on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler

media:content.media:description: The Reiner home in the Brentwood section of Los Angeles on Tuesday.

item.title: HHS Cancels Grants to Group That Criticized RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Policies
item.description: The American Academy of Pediatrics had called the department’s policies “irresponsible and purposefully misleading” and joined a lawsuit against its vaccine policy.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim

media:content.media:credit: Michael A. McCoy for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The United States Department of Health and Human Services headquarters in October.

item.title: Trump’s Claim That Venezuela ‘Stole’ U.S. Oil Fields Sets Off a Nationalist Reaction
item.description: President Trump said the United States wanted to reclaim expropriated oil assets, setting off a nationalist reaction in a country where the resource holds a mythical status.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero
item.category: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

media:content.media:description: Derricks in the Maracaibo oil fields of Venezuela in the early 20th century. American oil companies invested millions of dollars in the region, generating profits that flowed to the United States, rather than Venezuela.

item.title: New Details Emerge in Reiner Deaths as Son Makes First Court Appearance
item.description: Rob and Michele Reiner were found fatally stabbed in the master bedroom of their home, a police official said. Their younger son, Nick Reiner, appeared in court on Wednesday to face murder charges, but did not enter a plea.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
